title: Engineering (General)
description: Professional engineering across multiple disciplines — design
roadmap_steps: 12th with Physics & Mathematics; minimum aggregate as per college/university.
postgraduate_options: JEE Main|JEE Advanced (for IITs)|State CETs (e.g., MHTCET)
popular_specializations: Complete 10+2 with PCM and required percentage.|Prepare for and appear in national/state engineering entrance exams (JEE Main, State CETs).|Participate in counselling/allotment; select college & branch based on rank/cutoff.|Enroll in B.E/B.Tech (4 years). Focus on projects, internships, and placements.|Optional: Pursue M.Tech/MS (2 years) or MBA/industry certifications; or enter workforce.
column15: 4 years (UG) + 2 years (PG optional)
column16: Cutoffs vary drastically by college & specialization. Encourage internships and coding/soft-skill practice.

title: Computer Science & IT
description: Software development, systems design, data engineering, AI/ML, cybersecurity and related tech roles.
eligibility: 12th with PCM; proficiency in mathematics recommended.
entrance_exams: JEE Main|JEE Advanced|State CETs|Direct college exams (e.g., VITEEE)
roadmap_steps: Complete 12th with strong math foundation.|Prepare for entrance exams and secure admission to a reputable CS/IT program.|Complete B.Tech/B.E in CS/IT; build portfolio (projects, GitHub), internships and competitions.|Choose electives in AI, ML, Data Science, Cybersecurity, or Cloud computing.|Enter industry as SW engineer or pursue MSc/MS in specialized areas.
postgraduate_options: M.Tech (CSE)|MSc (CS)|MS abroad|Ph.D.
possible_career_paths: Software Engineer|Data Scientist|ML Engineer|DevOps Engineer|Security Analyst
notes: Strong practical portfolio and internships matter more than brand sometimes. Online certifications helpful.

title: Mechanical Engineering
postgraduate_options: JEE Main|State CETs
popular_specializations: Finish 12th with PCM.|Appear for engineering entrance exams and secure a mechanical engineering seat.|Complete B.E/B.Tech in Mechanical; focus on CAD, Thermodynamics, Manufacturing labs.|Take internships in manufacturing, automotive or robotics; learn CAD/CAM tools.|Consider M.Tech in specialized areas or enter industries like automotive, aerospace, energy.
column15: 4 years UG + 2 years PG (optional)
column16: Strong practical skills and internships increase employability in industry.

title: Civil Engineering
postgraduate_options: Mathematics|Physics|Chemistry
popular_specializations: JEE Main|State CETs|Architecture/NATA for related fields
possible_career_paths: Complete 12th with PCM.|Appear for entrance exams; choose Civil branch in college.|Complete B.E/B.Tech in Civil; focus on surveying, structural analysis, materials.|Intern with construction firms; learn software (AutoCAD, STAAD Pro, ETABS).|Pursue M.Tech, structural engineering or join construction/project management roles.
column15: Site Engineer|Structural Engineer|Project Manager|Consultant
column17: Field visits and internships provide practical exposure; safety & regulatory knowledge important.

title: Electrical & Electronics Engineering (EEE/ECE)
postgraduate_options: JEE Main|JEE Advanced|State CETs
popular_specializations: Finish 12th with PCM.|Clear engineering entrance exams and join EEE/ECE program.|During UG, take labs in electronics, circuits, signal processing and communications.|Internships in telecom, electronics manufacturing or power utilities.|Pursue specialized PG (Power systems, VLSI) or industry roles.
column14: Hardware Engineer|Embedded Systems Developer|Power Engineer|Telecom Engineer
column15: 4 years UG + 2 years PG (optional)
column16: Hands-on projects (IoT, embedded) are highly valuable.

title: Aerospace & Aeronautical Engineering
entrance_exams: 12th with PCM; strong physics & math background.
postgraduate_options: Complete 12th with strong PCM performance.|Clear entrance exams and secure admission to an aerospace program.|Complete B.Tech/B.E in Aerospace; focus on aerodynamics, propulsion and structures.|Intern at aerospace companies/ISRO/DRDO or in aircraft maintenance organizations.|Pursue M.Tech or specialized roles in design, testing, or space research.
column15: Opportunities with defense, space agencies and private aerospace firms; internships competitive.

title: Biomedical / Bioengineering
description: Application of engineering principles to healthcare: medical devices
entrance_exams: 12th with PCM (some programs accept PCB + Maths).
postgraduate_options: Complete 12th with PCM/PCB depending on institute requirements.|Secure admission into biomedical engineering program.|During UG, focus on biomedical instruments, biomechanics and clinical internships.|Collaborate with hospitals for device testing; build multidisciplinary projects.|Pursue M.Tech/M.S or clinical engineering roles; research opportunities in med-tech startups.
column15: Strong cross-disciplinary collaboration with hospitals and clinicians is beneficial.

title: Biotechnology & Life Sciences
description: Study and application of biological systems for health
entrance_exams: 12th with PCB (PCM acceptable for some programs).
undergraduate_options: National/State level biotech/university tests|Some institutes accept JEE/NEET scores
postgraduate_options: Complete 12th with PCB/PCM as per college requirement.|Take entrance tests and join B.Tech/B.Sc in Biotechnology or related programs.|Gain lab experience, internships in biotech firms, and project work in molecular biology.|Consider MSc/M.Tech in Biotechnology or specialized diplomas.|Pursue research, pharma/biotech industry roles or Ph.D. for academic careers.
column14: 3-4 years UG + 2 years PG (optional) + Ph.D. if chosen
column15: Lab exposure and research internships are crucial; industry experience valuable for job roles.

title: Medical (MBBS/BDS/AYUSH)
description: Clinical practice and medical research; MBBS leads to physician/medical specialist careers; BDS for dentistry; AYUSH for traditional medicine.
eligibility: 12th with PCB and required aggregate; NEET for MBBS/BDS; AYUSH has separate counselling.
entrance_exams: NEET-UG (MBBS/BDS)|State NEET counselling|NTA counselling for All India quota
roadmap_steps: Complete 12th with PCB with high marks.|Prepare for and clear NEET-UG; secure a seat in MBBS/BDS/AYUSH through counselling.|Complete MBBS (5.5 years including internship) or BDS (5 years) or AYUSH program.|Complete internship/house-surgeon tenure and register with Medical Council.|Optionally pursue MD/MS/DNB (3 years) specialization or practice as a general physician.
postgraduate_options: MD|MS|DNB|M.Ch|DM|Ph.D.
notes: Highly competitive; high NEET rank required for top government colleges.

title: Pharmacy
undergraduate_options: State/University entrance tests; some accept NEET/JEE scores for integrated programs
postgraduate_options: Complete 12th with requisite subjects.|Appear for university/state entrance exams and select B.Pharm program.|Complete B.Pharm (4 years) with practicals and internships in pharma companies.|Options: M.Pharm, Pharm.D. (clinical pharmacy), or industry roles in QA/QC, R&D.|Possibility to pursue Ph.D. or regulatory/clinical research careers.
column15: Clinical pharmacy (Pharm.D) leads to hospital pharmacy careers; pharma industry opportunities widely available.

title: Nursing & Allied Health Sciences
postgraduate_options: Biology|Chemistry|Physics
popular_specializations: State/college-level allied health entrance tests; some direct admissions
possible_career_paths: Complete 12th with PCB or relevant subjects.|Apply for B.Sc Nursing, BPT (Physiotherapy), BMLT (Medical Lab Tech) or diploma courses.|Complete UG program with clinical rotations and internships in hospitals.|Register with respective councils (e.g., Nursing Council) and join healthcare settings.|Optionally pursue M.Sc, specialized certifications, or research.
column14: Critical Care Nursing|Pediatric Nursing|Cardiac Care|Physiotherapy specialties
column15: Staff Nurse|Physiotherapist|Lab Technician|Clinical Specialist
column17: High demand and job stability; clinical experience crucial.

title: Architecture
entrance_exams: 12th with PCM/PCB/Arts; many colleges require specific boards' marks.
undergraduate_options: NATA|JEE Paper II (Architecture) - where applicable|Institute-specific tests
postgraduate_options: Complete 12th with required subjects and build a portfolio (sketches/designs).|Appear for NATA/JEE (Paper II) and secure admission to B.Arch (5 years).|Complete B.Arch with studio projects, internships and site visits.|Register with Council of Architecture (where required) and practice as an architect.|Options: M.Arch, urban design, interior design, conservation, or start a design firm.
column15: Portfolio quality and design sensibility matter greatly; combine technical and creative skills.

title: Pure Sciences (Physics / Chemistry / Mathematics / Biology)
description: Academic and research-oriented careers in core scientific disciplines leading to teaching
entrance_exams: 12th with relevant science subject combination (PCM or PCB).
undergraduate_options: University entrance exams for B.Sc; IISER/JEST/JAM for advanced programs|IIT-JAM for PG in sciences
postgraduate_options: Select B.Sc in chosen subject(s) after 12th.|During UG, focus on rigorous coursework, labs, and undergraduate research projects.|Pursue M.Sc / M.Phil in specialized areas; clear exams like IIT JAM for admissions to premier institutes.|Undertake Ph.D. for research & academic positions or join R&D labs/industry.|Optionally move into teaching (college/university), research institutes, or interdisciplinary sectors (data science, finance).
notes: Research Scientist|University Lecturer|R&D in industry|Data Scientist (with additional skills)
column14: 3 years UG + 2 years PG + 3-5 years Ph.D. (if chosen)
column15: Research skills, publications, and strong academic performance are critical for top roles.

title: Data Science
recommended_12th_subjects: programming and domain knowledge to extract insights from data and build intelligent systems.
entrance_exams: 12th with PCM and strong math background preferred.
undergraduate_options: Entrance via UG CS/Statistics/Math programs; later specialization via PG entrance tests or university admissions
postgraduate_options: Complete 12th with strong mathematics foundation and basic programming exposure.|Pursue B.Sc/B.Tech in CS/Statistics/Mathematics or related fields.|Learn programming (Python/R), statistics, machine learning libraries and build projects.|Internships in data/ML teams; consider specialized PG (M.Tech/ MSc (DS)/MS) or certifications.|Work as Data Analyst/Scientist/ML Engineer or pursue Ph.D. in AI/ML for research roles.
column15: Portfolio of projects, competitions (Kaggle), and internships are key differentiators.

title: Environmental Science & Engineering
postgraduate_options: University/state entrance tests; some institutes have their own tests
popular_specializations: Complete 12th with required subjects and apply for B.Sc/ B.Tech Environmental Science/Engineering.|During UG, focus on ecology, environmental chemistry, pollution control and fieldwork.|Intern with environmental NGOs, labs or government agencies.|Pursue M.Sc/M.Tech in Environmental Science or related policy/management courses.|Work in environmental consulting, research, government regulatory bodies, or sustainability roles in industry.
column15: 3-4 years UG + 2 years PG (optional)
column16: Fieldwork and interdisciplinary skills (policy, law, tech) increase employability.

title: Agricultural Sciences & Horticulture
roadmap_steps: 12th with PCB/PCM (varies by course and college).
postgraduate_options: State agricultural university entrance tests; ICAR AIEEA (for some seats)
popular_specializations: Complete 12th and apply to agricultural universities (B.Sc Agri, B.Sc Horticulture).|Engage in practical farm training, internships and agri-projects.|Pursue M.Sc/ Ph.D. or specialized diplomas; learn agritech tools, precision agriculture.|Work in agri-based industries, research institutes, government extension services, or start agribusiness.
column15: 3-4 years UG + 2 years PG (optional)
column16: Rapidly evolving sector with agri-tech and sustainability opportunities.

title: Veterinary Science
recommended_12th_subjects: veterinary research and public health roles.
entrance_exams: 12th with PCB; competitive entrance exams for BVSc & AH.
postgraduate_options: Complete 12th with PCB and apply to BVSc & AH programs.|Undergo practical clinical training and internships in veterinary hospitals/farms.|Graduate (BVSc) and obtain registration/licensing where required.|Pursue specialization via MVSc or Ph.D., or work in public health, research, or animal husbandry.
typical_timeline: Small Animal Practice|Large Animal Practice|Veterinary Pathology
column15: Field-heavy career; government jobs and private practice are common paths.

title: Forensic Science
description: Application of scientific methods to crime investigation: forensic biology
undergraduate_options: University-level entrance tests; some institutes have specialized programs
postgraduate_options: Complete 12th and enroll in B.Sc Forensic Science or related course.|Gain practical lab experience in forensic techniques and internships with forensic labs or police departments.|Pursue M.Sc in Forensic Science or specialized certifications in forensic technology.|Work with law enforcement, forensic labs, or private consultancy; pursue Ph.D. for advanced research.
popular_specializations: B.Sc Forensic Science|B.Sc (Chemistry/Biology) with forensic electives
notes: Forensic Analyst|Crime Lab Technician|Digital Forensic Expert
column15: Interdisciplinary skillset; legal and ethical understanding important.

title: Marine Science & Oceanography
recommended_12th_subjects: coastal ecosystems and marine resource management.
undergraduate_options: University-level admissions; specialized marine science institutes have criteria
postgraduate_options: Complete 12th and apply for B.Sc in Marine Science or related programs.|Participate in fieldwork, cruises and lab internships to gain practical oceanographic skills.|Pursue M.Sc and Ph.D. in marine science for research careers.|Work with research institutes, government marine departments, fisheries, or environmental NGOs.
column14: 3 years UG + 2 years PG + Ph.D. (if chosen)
column15: Field expeditions and specialized equipment skills required.

title: Geology & Earth Sciences
postgraduate_options: University entrance tests; some geology departments conduct their own exams
popular_specializations: Complete 12th and enroll in B.Sc Geology or related degrees.|Field camps, mapping exercises and internships in mining/exploration companies.|Pursue M.Sc/Ph.D. for advanced research or specialized industry roles.|Work in mineral exploration, oil & gas, environmental consulting, or academia.
column15: 3 years UG + 2 years PG (optional)
column16: Fieldwork and practical mapping skills are core to the field.

title: Astronomy & Astrophysics
undergraduate_options: University admissions for B.Sc; MSc/Ph.D. through national programs and institute-specific tests
postgraduate_options: Complete 12th and pursue B.Sc in Physics/Applied Physics or related subject.|Take electives in astrophysics/astronomy and gain programming & data-analysis skills.|Pursue M.Sc and then Ph.D. in Astrophysics for research roles.|Work at observatories, research institutions, space agencies or academia.
notes: Researcher|Observatory Scientist|Data Analyst in space science
column15: Strong math & programming ability essential; international collaboration common.

title: Interdisciplinary / Emerging Fields (Biostatistics
recommended_12th_subjects: Careers at the intersection of disciplines — materials research
postgraduate_options: 12th with PCM/PCB depending on field.
possible_career_paths: University/Institute specific; some require GATE/JAM/other PG tests for advanced entry
typical_timeline: Choose relevant UG (B.Sc/B.Tech) with strong core subject knowledge.|Engage in interdisciplinary projects, internships and lab rotations.|Pursue specialized PG degrees (M.Tech, M.Sc, MS) or research fellowships.|Work in R&D labs, high-tech manufacturing, biotech or computational research roles.
column15: Materials Science|Nanotechnology|Bioinformatics|Biostatistics
column17: 3-4 years UG + 2 years PG + Ph.D. (if research oriented)
column18: Strong research orientation and lab skills important; collaborations across departments common.
